bibl.title: Charles W. Sawyer v. T.J. Hamilton. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington

body.p: In the District Court of the third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle
In the application of Charles W. Sawyer for release upon writ of Habeas Corpus....
To the HON. R.A. Jones Judge presiding. -
Your petitioner Charles Sawyer respectfully shows to-wit,

FIRST:- That he is now being restrained illegaly of his liberty without his consent or permission and without authority of any kind whatsoever by T.J Hamilton - UNITED STATES MARSHAL in the city Seattle King County, Washington. In the personal custody of the said Hamilton Marshal as aforesaid
SECOND:- That the cause and pretense for such illegal restraint of this petitioner is that the petitioner believes, a paper puporting to be an indictment and warrant which your petitioner
THIRD:- That the illegality of the restraint of your petitioner to wit
Lewis and Gilman attys for petitioner
AND THAT HE IS THE PETITIONER
In the application of Charles W. Sawyer for whose upon writ of Habeas Corpus
James Seavey, Clerk. By W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy Clerk.
LEWIS & GILMAN, attorneys at Law. SEATTLE, WASH. TER.
